title: SoC RTVF 360-0-23 Topics in Media Writing

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: To write a science fiction or fantasy film/play/tv show, you must splice together the skills of a screenwriter and a talent for imagining alternate realities - the possible and impossible. Class meetings will include discussions of the classic characteristics of these genres and the varying sub-genres, in-class writing exercises, and group critique. There will be weekly writing assignments and by the end of the quarter, students should have at least four polished scenes, representing the key story moments of their plays and screenplays.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Attendance, written assignments, and class participation.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Handouts & articles given in class on specific topics and the work generated by classmates.

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value: Students must come to the first class with a story premise in mind for a play or feature-length screenplay.
